conclusion: To measure the volume of some irregularly shaped solids that are inconvenient to immerse in liquid, the device shown in the figure is used for measurement.
The operating steps and experimental data are provided to determine the volume of the measured solid.
Connect the device to the liquid, ensuring that the liquid is at the desired temperature.
Measure the volume of the liquid in the container (C) before any solid is added.
Add the solid to the liquid in the container.
Measure the volume of the liquid in the container after the solid has been added.

premise: The volume of the solid can be calculated by subtracting the initial volume of the liquid from the final volume of the liquid.
conclusion: Volume of solid = Final volume of liquid - Initial volume of liquid

conclusion: Final volume of liquid = Volume of liquid in container + Volume of solid
